section.name: Welcome to Aozan

div.style: float: right; margin: 0 10px 20px 20px; padding: 5px; border: 1px solid #999; background-color: #eee;

section.p: Aozan has been developped in order to automatically handle raw data transfert, demultiplexing and quality control once an HiSeq run has been finished. This software is involved in the primary data analysis and produce from an HiSeq sequencer output, compressed FASTQ files and a quality report in order to evaluate each sequencing parameter. Aozan can works on most computer infrastructures and only requieres the creation of a samplesheet for each run.
Aozan greatly helps to improve efficiency with run data management and to keep tracks of run statistics with several automatic mail information and HTML report pages.

img.alt: Example on quality control run report

section.name: Sample sheet validator
section.p: We also provide a CASAVA/bcl2fastq samplesheet validator to help users to check their run design. This tool use only html and javascript. No data is sent to our servers when you use this tool.

subsection.name: FastQC version 0.11.2

img.alt: FastQC: new per tile sequence quality module

p.p: Like previous version, the same enhancement are included in this version : "Bad tiles" and "Overrepresented sequences" with optional Blastn on "no hit" sequences.
All parameters on FastQC can be settings in Aozan configuration.

subsection.name: Analysis undetermined fastq

p.a: Add modules to recovery clusters, details here.

subsection.p:
The undetermined fastq from demultiplexing step are parsing to collect all indices. For each, it proposes the sample(s) corresponding with one mismatch more that used for demultiplexing. Two reports are generate in csv and html formats :
a recovery clusters for each indexed lanes : listing all indices collected and the potential samples present in lanes, with data on parsing filter.
a recovery clusters for each indexed samples : listing all indices identify to the sample from the lane, with data on parsing filter.

Two parameters have been added in the configuration Aozan file to run FastQC and contamination detection on undetermined fastq. For contamination detection, the genomes databank used includes all genomes contaminants from configuration file and all genomes from samplesheet file, when they are available for mapping. This data can help to understand origin of problems occuring during sequencing.

subsection.name: Using Aozan in multiserver context
subsection.p: Now Aozan can use several configuration files with the keyword "include" at first line in configuration to set a other configuration file path, it will loaded first.

subsection.name: New globals tests in quality control report
subsection.p:
Enhancement of the quality control report, with a new table on globals test: listing data on all lanes in run more details here.
An example of table built with lanes global tests.

subsection.name: FastQC and enhancement
subsection.p: The quality control steps contains an additional FastQC module named "Bad tiles" that search tiles with BMS (Bottom Middle Swath) issues with Illumina flowcell v3.

Optionally, Aozan adds a sub-step in FastQC to enhance the Overrepresented sequences module. For sequences with "no hit", a blastn can be launch to estimate the source. Blastn results with 100% identity and 0% gap will be included in report.

img.alt: module overrepresented sequences with results from blastn

subsection.name: Contamination detection with FastQ-Screen
subsection.p: Aozan now include a fast Java FastQ Screen implementation. This module maps reads samples on a list of reference genomes for assessing sample contamination and the ratio of the expected genome in the sample. It creates a report file with values for each genome.

subsection.name: Reading Illumina InterOp binary files
subsection.p: Run data are now retrieved by parsing Illumina InterOp Binary Metric files as Illumina XML run files are now deprecated.

img.alt: example on report with run data

subsection.name: Continuous synchronization of HiSeq data
subsection.p: Aozan can now perform continuous synchronizations of working runs to avoid a big synchronizations at the end of the runs.
